advice.lifestyle: A healthy diet, regular exercise and reduction in risk factors is key to disease prevention

Salt (sodium chloride): Restrict to less than 5 grams (1 teaspoon) per day
Reduce salt when cooking, limit processed and fast foods
Fruits &amp; Vegetables: 5 servings (400-500 grams) of fruits and vegetable per day
1 serving is equivalent to 1 orange, apple, mango, banana or 3 tablespoons of cooked vegetables
Fatty Food: Limit fatty meat, dairy fat and cooking oil (less than two tablespoons per day)
Replace palm and coconut oil with olive, soya, corn, rapeseed or safflower oil
Replace other meat with chicken (without skin)

physical_activity: Progressively increase physical activity to moderate levels (such as brisk walking); at least 150 minutes per week
Control body weight and avoid overweight by reducing high calorie food and taking adequate physical activity
